articles.title: Man dies after being struck by MBTA commuter rail train in Haverhill
articles.description:
Transit police say the man "intentionally entered" onto the right of way.

The post Man dies after being struck by MBTA commuter rail train in Haverhill appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Man intentionally entered the right of way and was struck by an MBTA train.
Incident occurred in Haverhill, impacting local commuter rail services.
Transit police are investigating the circumstances surrounding the man's actions.

articles.title: Boston Raising Cane’s faces eviction over chicken finger odor, lawsuit says
articles.description:
The chicken finger chain claims they're being extorted by their landlord over building and lease issues.

The post Boston Raising Cane’s faces eviction over chicken finger odor, lawsuit says appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Raising Cane's in Boston faces eviction due to alleged odor complaints from the landlord.
The chicken finger chain claims extortion over lease issues in the lawsuit filed.
Potential eviction could disrupt local jobs and dining options for Boston residents.

articles.title: FBI releases first surveillance images of masked person on Nancy Guthrie’s porch
articles.description:
“The video was recovered from residual data located in backend systems,” Patel wrote, saying the images show “an armed individual appearing to have tampered with the camera at Nancy Guthrie’s front door the morning of her disappearance.”

The post FBI releases first surveillance images of masked person on Nancy Guthrie’s porch appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: FBI released surveillance images of a masked individual on Nancy Guthrie's porch.
The incident occurred the morning of her disappearance, raising community concerns.
Residents are urged to remain vigilant as the investigation continues.
